metadata.title: CVE-2022-3563 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - low
metadata.description:
A vulnerability classified as problematic has been found in Linux Kernel.Affected is the function read_50_controller_cap_complete of the filetools/mgmt-tester.c of the component BlueZ. The manipulation of theargument cap_len leads to null pointer dereference. It is recommended toapply a patch to fix this issue. VDB-211086 is the identifier assigned tothis vulnerability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-3563` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

bluetooth - 5.65-0ubuntu1
bluez - 5.65-0ubuntu1
bluez-cups - 5.65-0ubuntu1
bluez-hcidump - 5.65-0ubuntu1
bluez-meshd - 5.65-0ubuntu1
bluez-obexd - 5.65-0ubuntu1
bluez-tests - 5.65-0ubuntu1
libbluetooth3 - 5.65-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: bluez package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.65-0ubuntu1').
